page.title: 11SWINDERBY RIDING STABLES.
page.content: {Jetna House Farm} dates from 1850. It wasn't used for keeping horses until 1973 when the Betts' family moved there and rebuilt the house. The 33 {horses}are kept on 30 acres of pasture land. There are 12 stables but most of the horses stay outside all year round. Each horse eats about 25 to 30 kg. a day which during the summer consists of grass, whilst in winter it is hay, cereal and carrots. The{food}costs in 1985 are as follows: Barley Â£4.60 per 25k.g. Hay Â£1.50 per 50k.g.bale. Oats Â£4.50 per 25k.g. Carrots Â£0.50 per bag. {Riding School. This was started in June 1985. The costs of lessons are: Â£3 per hour in a group and Â£2 per half hour for individual tuition.
